greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of 1/(1-4*x)^(19/2).
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..200
formula: a(n)=binomial(n+9, 9)*A000984(n+9)/A000984(9), where A000984 are the central binomial coefficients. - _Wolfdieter Lang_
Boas-Buck recurrence: a(n) = (38/n)*Sum_{k=0..n-1} 4^(n-k-1)*a(k), n >= 1, a(0) = 1. Proof from a(n) = A046521(n+9, 9). See a comment there. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Aug 10 2017
program: (MAGMA) [&*[2*n+i: i in [1..17 by 2]]*Binomial(2*n, n)/34459425: n in [0..20]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jul 05 2013
(PARI) vector(20, n, n--; m=n+9; binomial(2*m,m)*binomial(m, 9)/binomial(18,9) ) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 21 2019
(Sage) [binomial(2*(n+9),n+9)*binomial(n+9, 9)/binomial(18,9) for n in (0..20)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 21 2019
(GAP) List([0..20], n-> Binomial(2*(n+9), n+9)*Binomial(n+9, 9)/Binomial(18, 9)); # _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 21 2019
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
